hangle: 애초에 피오나가 최종 보스가 된 이유
first_translate: the reason why fiona became the final boss...

hangle: 그것은 어둠과 계약한 힘을 통제하지 못하게 되었기 때문이다.
first_translate: ...was because she lost control over her powers after making a deal with darkness.

hangle: 그녀가 어둠과 계약한 데에는 여러 이유가 있었지만,
first_translate: she had many reasons for doing so,

hangle: 결정적인 요인이 된 인물은 바로 아렌트였다.
first_translate: but the person that made up her mind was none other than arendt himself.

hangle: 그리고 현재 내가 빙의한 몸은 피오나.
first_translate: and right now I’m possessing fiona’s body.

hangle: 솔직히 아렌트를 까먹고 있던 이유는 간단하다.
first_translate: to be honest, there's one simple reason why I forgot about him until now.

hangle: 지금까지 내가 시그렌을 너무 신경 쓰고 있었으니까.
first_translate: it's because all my attention has been on siegren this whole time.
siegren...
I didn’t think he’d appear here already when his character doesn’t even show up until halfway through the story.

hangle: 원작 시작 전인 지금 벌써 내가 있는 곳에 등장할 줄이야.
first_translate: this isn’t supposed to happen yet since we’re still at the beginning of the novel.
with how big the capital city is,

hangle: 어떻게 이렇게 아렌트와 운명처럼 마주칠 수가…
first_translate: how did I run into him like fate brought us together or something--

hangle: 순수하게 확률로 따져도 굉장히 낮을 텐데.
first_translate: even statistically speaking, the chances would have been very low.

hangle: 나는 대체 얼마나 운이 안 좋은거야?!
first_translate: do I really have such bad luck?!
arendt clovis.
his keywords are “schemer” and “villain.”
while everyone else thinks he’s trash,
in front of the woman he loves, he becomes affectionate.

hangle: 분명 여주인공 시점으로 읽으면 꽤 재밌고 설레는 인물이다.
first_translate: from the heroine’s perspective, he must’ve seemed quite charming and exciting.
but from someone else’s point of view,
or worse, meeting him in real life?
you'd want to run as far away from him as possible!!!

hangle: 아렌트는 겉모습이랑 달리 성격이 엄청 더럽다구.
first_translate: unlike what you might expect based on appearance alone, arendt actually has a terrible personality.
well, oh well.

hangle: 여차해서 일이 꼬이면 내가 먼저 쟤를 암살해 버려야겠다.
first_translate: if push comes to shove, maybe I’ll just assassinate him first.

hangle: 날 최종보스로 만들려는 모든 캐릭터를 죽이면
first_translate: that way, by killing off every character trying to turn me into the final boss,

hangle: 나는 선량한 피오나로 살아갈 수 있겠지.
first_translate: I can live happily ever after as good ol’ fiona.
muahaha!
lady fiona...?
she ran out quickly.
she looks no older than late teens.
but she seems to recognize me.
not once have I revealed my title,

hangle: 내가 누군지 아는 건 그리 이상한 일은 아니다.
first_translate: but it wouldn’t be strange for people to know who I am.

hangle: 난 수도 사교계에 꽤 알려져 있으니까.
first_translate: after all, I'm pretty famous among high society circles in the capital.
still...
that reaction...

hangle: 여태껏 내 얼굴을 보며 그런 표정을 지은 여자는 처음이었어.
first_translate: no girl has ever looked at me like that before.

hangle: 게다가 가볍게 손댄 것만으로 마석이 그렇게 변하다니.
first_translate: on top of that, those magic stones changed color simply by being touched lightly.
she must be a powerful magician.
but what’s odd is...

hangle: 그 정도 솜씨라면 진즉 사교계에도 알려졌을 게 분명한데,
first_translate: a skillful magician like herself should've become known within our social circle long ago,
yet I don’t remember seeing her face anywhere.
did she say her name was celine...?

hangle: 그 수준의 마법사라면 내가 하려는 일에 필시 도움이 될 거야.
first_translate: for what I plan to do, having a skilled magician like her will definitely come in handy.
I need to find that noble lady.
don’t leave me behind!
gosh almighty!
isn’t this taking too long?!

hangle: 역시 아벨은 이 짓을 하기 싫어서 나한테 떠민 게 분명해.
first_translate: as expected, abel probably pushed this task onto me because he hated doing it.
I wanna confront him immediately,

hangle: 아직 아벨과 시그렌이 수도에 도착할 시점까지는 좀 남았지….
first_translate: but there’s some time left before abel and siegren arrive in the capital...
since siegren appears before the nobles...

hangle: 분명 꽃 축제의 꽃이 전부 질 무렵이니까.
first_translate: ...when most flowers start wilting during the flower festival,
I guess they'll get here in roughly another month.
come in.
oh, celine!
my lady, may I see you for a moment?
okay! let me take a break then.
what is it?
celine...
wait, these aren’t normal dresses for going outside, are they?
they’re ball gowns, my lady.
of course...

hangle: 드레스를 이미 잔뜩 맞췄는데 또 맞추자고 해서 뭔가 싶었는데,
first_translate: I thought it was weird when mother asked me to order more dresses despite already getting plenty tailored recently.
and besides,
this place is marian dress shop, isn’t it?
marian dress shop.

hangle: 말 그대로 수도 귀족 영애들에게 동경의 대상인 곳이다.
first_translate: it’s literally where all young ladies aspire to visit someday.

hangle: 왜 소설 속에서 그런 곳 있지 않은가.
first_translate: why does a place like this exist only in novels?
all the noblewomen wish to buy their clothes here,

hangle: 드레스 한 벌 받으려면 몇 달은 기다려야 한다고 설명하는 그런 의상실.
first_translate: but apparently, you have to wait months to receive your orders.
except for the main characters, of course.

hangle: 밥 먹듯이 드레스를 맞추는 그런 장소.
first_translate: there, they can get custom-made dresses whenever they please.
talk about unfair!

hangle: 여주인 유니스도 이 의상실에서 드레스를 맞추곤 했다.
first_translate: even the original protagonist, eunice, used to tailor her dresses here.

hangle: 아마 아렌트가 그녀를 유혹할 때 그런 장면이 있었던 걸로 기억한다.
first_translate: I recall reading scenes where arendt tried seducing her while shopping here.

hangle: 그런 의상실을 이토록 쉽게 이용할 수 있다니.
first_translate: now I can use this amazing dress shop however I want.

hangle: 과연 헤일론 가문이라고 감탄해야 할 지.
first_translate: I wonder whether I should thank house haylon for this privilege.
then again,
doesn’t this feel kinda fishy?
something feels off.
ahh... lady fiona...

hangle: 아가씨와 이렇게 옷을 보고 있으니 손녀와 드레스를 보던게 생각나네요.
first_translate: looking at dresses with you reminds me of picking them out with my granddaughter back in the day.

hangle: 이젠 손녀와 그러는 건 힘든 일이지만…
first_translate: although it’s hard to spend quality time with her nowadays...

hangle: 그치만 셀린 때문에 이상해도 끽 소리 하나 낼 수가 없어~!!
first_translate: because of celine, I couldn’t complain even if I wanted to!!
my lady,

hangle: 의상실 직원들과 할 이야기가 조금 남았는데,
first_translate: I still have some matters to discuss with the employees here.

hangle: 맞은 편의 카페에서 기다려 주실 수 있을까요?
first_translate: can you wait for me across the street at the cafe?
alright, gotcha.
refreshing!
I never imagined drinking anything cold like this...
...while living under house haylon.

hangle: 이렇게 맨날 추운 법이 어디 있어~!!
first_translate: where could anyone enjoy weather like this year-round?!
the weather’s nice,
and I drank something refreshing...
this is exactly what I needed today!
glad I came o--
oh dear,
fancy running into you again.
that voice...
duke arendt...
nice to meet you,
lady celine.
